CreditLine: Gift of the A. Jay Fink Foundation, Inc., in memory of Abraham Jay Fink, 1963
Description: Small portraits of those to whom one was connected by family, friendship, or political allegiance were treasured first as likenesses and second as works of art. Just as today, a "good" photo of someone is one that "looks like" the person. They were often given as gifts. They could be hung in a decorative arrangement or kept in a cabinet and taken out to be contemplated. Some were worn as pendants.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: Small Northern European Portraits from The Walters Art Gallery, Baltimore
Exhibitions.Textblock: Small Northern European Portraits from The Walters Art Gallery, Baltimore. National Gallery of Art, Washington. 2000.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: Four Centuries of Miniature Painting from the Collections of the A. Jay Fink Foundation, Inc. and A.J. Fink, Personally

Provenance: Dr. James Simon, Berlin [no. 84]; Abraham Jay Fink, Baltimore, no. A-41; A.J. Fink Foundation, Baltimore, 1963, by bequest; Walters Art Museum, Baltimore, 1963, by gift.
Title: Portrait of a Man
